page.title: 08BRUNEL ATMOSPHERIC RAILWAY
page.content: In Starcross there stands the last remaining pumping house which was used to power an{Atmospheric Railway}which ran from Exeter to Newton Abbot.{ {Isambard Kingdom Brunel}recommended this system to S.Devon railway company.It was a system which was driven by a vacuum.A continuous iron pipe was laid between the rails.The pumping houses pumped air out of the pipe,which had a slot in it covered by a leather flap.The flap was hinged on one side but would lift on the other. Underneath the front carriage a rod carried the piston inside the pipe. There were two wheels in the front which raised the flap.The vacuum ahead of the piston enabled atmospheric pressure behind to push it,and the train,forward.A small wheel behind the piston pressed down the flap and sealed it.{Open daily from 10am-6pm.
